solution_line_template: Whitney is buying {num_posters} posters for ${poster_price} each, so the posters will cost {num_posters}*${poster_price}= $<<{num_posters}*{poster_price}={poster_total}>>{poster_total} total cost for posters.

Whitney is buying {num_notebooks} notebooks for ${notebook_price} each, so the notebooks will cost {num_notebooks}*${notebook_price}= $<<{num_notebooks}*{notebook_price}={notebook_total}>>{notebook_total} total cost for notebooks.

Whitney is buying {num_bookmarks} notebooks for ${bookmark_price}, so the bookmarks {num_bookmarks}*${bookmark_price}= $<<{num_bookmarks}*{bookmark_price}={bookmark_total}>>{bookmark_total} total cost for bookmarks.

Since Whitney is paying ${poster_total} for posters, ${notebook_total} for notebooks, and ${bookmark_total} for bookmarks, her total purchase will cost ${poster_total}+${notebook_total}+${bookmark_total}= $<<{poster_total}+{notebook_total}+{bookmark_total}={total_purchase}>>{total_purchase} total purchase cost.
Whitney’s mom gave her {num_bills} ${bill_value} bills, so she will be paying with {num_bills}*${bill_value}=$<<{num_bills}*{bill_value}={total_payment}>>{total_payment} total payment.

Since Whitney is paying with ${total_payment} and her purchase cost will be ${total_purchase}, she will have ${total_payment}-${total_purchase}= $<<{total_payment}-{total_purchase}={leftover}>>{leftover} left over after the purchase.
